awd_titl_txt: REU Site: Sensor, Signal and Information Processing Devices and Algorithms
awd_abstract_narration:
This three year REU site will recruit and train nine undergraduate students each summer and engage them in research endeavors on the design of sensors including student training in mathematical methods for extracting information from sensor systems.  The investigators along with a team of faculty advisors will supervise a series of multidisciplinary projects in the design of integrated sensor systems.   In addition to the planned projects, the faculty leaders of this program will organize a series of industry collaborative training activities for the students.  This REU features multidisciplinary synergies across different research labs that provide access to unique sensor and algorithm technology. The program also includes crosscutting modules, and workshops in public speaking, policy, standards, ethics, patents, SBIR planning, and outreach.   Annual REU workshops will train students to communicate with stakeholders who can help establish new standards. An evaluation unit will assess REU goals annually using feedback from academia, industry and stakeholders.  The program engages minority colleges to broaden participation and enhance recruitment. 

The REU will address STEM problems associated with sensor applications in internet of things, health monitoring and security.  Specific objectives of the REU site are to:  a) introduce students to general research practices by immersing them in government and industry research activities, b) engage students in integrated design of sensor devices and relevant information processing methods, c) motivate students to pursue research careers,   d) provide cross cutting skills in presentation, developing patents, entrepreneurship, and building awareness on social implications, policies and standards.  The REU projects are designed to introduce students to an array of sensor device design technologies that emphasize low power circuits, flexible electronics, MEMS, and embedded systems.  During the same period, projects will train REU students to interpret data from sensors by studying and programming machine learning algorithms, sensor fusion methods, and techniques to interpret big data sets.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SITE-Res Exp for Ugrd Site

por.por_cntn:
This REU program created significant research innovations,  software, hardware, algorithms and other content in sensors and machine learning. Outcomes include publications, patents, and research reports co-authored by undergraduate participants. 

Publications: Approximately 30% of the participants became co-authors on conference papers. Publications include [1-20] and topics published include machine learning for audio [1-2], quantum computing  [3,4], Imaging [5-7 ], solar energy [8-10],  and sensor design [11-20].

Patent Disclosures of REU Participants include [21-26].  Patent disclosures and provisional patents were submitted on audio [21-22], imaging [23], solar energy [24], and sensor and circuit design [25-26].

More SenSIP REU Info incuding project reports, activity photos, posters, intellectual merit and broader impact statements in [27].

Publications Co-authored by REU Participants (bold font)

[1]     M. Esposito, G. Uehara, A. Spanias, Quantum Machine Learning for Audio Classification with Applications to Healthcare, 2022 IEEE IISA,2022.

[2]     M. Esposito, S. Rao, V. Narayanaswamy, A. Spanias,  "COVID-19 Detection using Audio Spectral Features and Machine Learning," IEEE Asilomar Conference on Circuits, Systems, Computers, Monterey, Oct. 2021. 

[3]     M. Yarter, G. Uehara, A. Spanias, ?Implementation and Analysis of Quantum Homomorphic Encryption, IEEE IISA,July 2022.  

[4]     G. Uehara, S. Rao, Mathew Dobson, C. Tepedelenlioglu, A. Spanias, "Quantum Neural Network Parameter Estimation for Photovoltaic Fault," Proc. IEEE IISA, 2021

[5]     D. Mohan, S. Katoch, S. Jayasuriya, P. Turaga, A. Spanias,  "Adaptive Video Subsampling For Energy-Efficient Object Detection," IEEE Asilomar Conference on Signals, Systems, Computers, Monterrey, Nov. 2019 

[6]     Olivia Christie, J. Rego, Suren Jayasuriya, "Energy-efficient ISP Pipelines for Visual SLAM Algorithms",  IEEE ICIP 2020. 

[7]     Odrika Iqbal, Saquib Siddiqui, Joshua Martin, Sameeksha Katoch, Andreas Spanias, Suren Jayasuriya, "Design and FPGA Implementation of an Adaptive Video Subsampling Algorithm for Energy-Efficient Single Object Tracking", IEEE ICIP, 2020. 

[8]     Dominique Smith, K. Jaskie, J. Cadigan, J. Marvin, A. Spanias,  "Machine Learning for Fast Short-Term Energy Load Forecasting," IEEE ICPS, 2020. 

[9]     E.  Pedersen, S. Rao, K. Jaskie, A. Spanias, C. Tepedelenlioglu, E. Kyriakides, "PV Array Fault Detection using Radial Basis Networks", Proc. IEEE IISA, 2019.

[10] K. Jaskie, J. Martin, A. Spanias, "PV Fault Detection using Positive Unlabeled Learning," Applied Sciences, 2021.  

[11] Farib Khondoker Trevor Thornton, Andreas Spanias, Uday  Shanthamallu, "Activity Detection and Exercise Routine Optimization via Sensor Fusion," Proc. IEEE IISA, 2018.

[12] Chad Snyder, Jennifer Blain Christen, Heather Ross, "Human Factors Engineering for Mobile Health Applications,"  2017 IEEE HI-POCT  conference, NIH Natcher Conference Center, NIH Bethesda Campus, .2017.

[13] Meilin Zhu, Uwadiae Obahiagbon, Karen Anderson, and Jennifer Blain Christen, "Highly Sensitive Fluorescence-based Lateral Flow Platform for Point-of-Care Detection of Biomarkers in Plasma," 2017 IEEE HI-POCT  conference, November2017, NIH Natcher Conference Center, Bethesda.

[14] B. Katchman, M. Zhu, J. Blain Christen, K. Anderson, "Eccrine Sweat as a Biofluid for Profiling Immune Biomarkers", Proteomics " Clinical Applications, published online on June 2018.  

[15] U. Obahaigbon, J.T. Smith, M. Zhu, B.A. Katchman, H. Arafa, K.S. Anderson, J. Blain Christen,"A Compact, Low-cost, Quantitative and Multiplexed Fluorescence Detection Platform for Point-of- Care Applications", Biosensors and Bioelectronics, vol. 117, pp. 153-160.

[16] C. Hou, M. Zhu, K.S. Anderson, U. Obahaigbon, J. Blain Christen, "Assay Development and Storage for Fluorescence-Based Lateral Flow Immunoassay." 2018 IEEE Life Sciences Conference, 2018.

[17] M. Zhu, C.Hou, U. Obahaigbon, K.S. Anderson, J. Blain Christen, "Characterizing Antibody-Microsphere Conjugates for Fluorescence-Based Lateral Flow Immunoassays." 2018 IEEE Life Sciences Conference,.2018. 

[18] B. Hertneky, J. Eger, M. Bailly, J. Blain Christen, "Mobile and Efficient Temperature and Humidity Control Chamber for Point-of-Care Diagnostics,"  IEEE HI-POCT 2019, Bethesda,

[19] R. Flores, S. Afshari, J. Blain Christen, ?Colorimetric Point-of-Care Human Papillomavirus Diagnostic Reader" 2019 IEEE HI-POCT, Bethesda.. 

[20] Agambayev, A., Sang, C. L., Christen, J. B., & Ozev, S. (2020, August). Enabling Large-scale Fine-grained Simulation of IED Vapor Concentration in Open-air Environments. IEEE MWSCAS, 2020.  

Patents Co-authored by REU Participants (students in bold font)

[21] P. Curtis. A. Spanias, M. Banavar, M16-089P,  "Android Acoustic Reflection Mapping", AzTE, 2015. 

[22] S. Rao, M. Esposito, V. Sivaraman Narayanaswamy, A. Spanias, Systems and Methods for a Deep Neural Network with Combined Cross-Entropy and Focal Loss for COVID-19 Audio Detection in Audio Samples ," US 63/232,862, 2021

[23]  S. Jayasuriya, P. Turaga, A. Spanias, S. Katoch, D. Mohan, Adaptive Video Subsampling For Energy Efficient Object Detection, US  62/872,902, 2019.

[24] K. Jaskie, Joshua Martin, A. Spanias   "Systems and Methods for Photovoltaic Fault Detection using a Feedback-Enhanced Positive Unlabeled Learning Method, Provisional  63/109,189. 2021.

[25] Jennifer Blain Christen, Clifford Anderson,  Thanh Nguyen, Michael  Hansen, Point of need fluid transport device, US20230109977A1

[26] Mark Bailly, Jesse Senko, Jennifer Blain Christen, Michael Goryll, Stuart Bowden, Christopher Lue Sang,  System including a self-powered, light-based, bycatch reduction device,  WO2021007442A1

[27] REU Site, https://sensip.engineering.asu.edu/reu-index-html/
